Column Comment.0: MEASURED SECTION ID: Unique identifier assigned to a measured section, asurface outcrop where the physical characteristics of the rock can be described.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AUTHOR: Name of the individual who examined the well samples and drafted thelithologic strip log.
Column Comment.4: DESCRIPTION: textual description of the field station
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: LOCATION DESCRIPTION: Description of the geographic lithologic strip log location(e.g., the north ridge of Mt. Rundle). The location is where the surface outcrop wasmeasured.
Column Comment.8: LOCATION QUALIFIER: Code designating the base map source for calculatinglatitude and longitude (e.g., Amman, USGS, etc.).
Column Comment.9: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE DOCUMENT: The document that was the source of the information for thisrow. For example government and regulatory agency forms, operator reports or scouttickets.
Column Comment.12: REFERENCE DATE: Date of the publication containing the measured sectionreference (e.g., September 1993 AAPG Bulletin).
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE DOCUMENT ID: Use this FK to identify a document that references themeasured section, usually in scientific literature.
Column Comment.15: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.16: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
